item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by T. A. Barron
item.description: "What makes this danger so terrible is that humans tip the balance of your world. No other species can make such a difference, for good or ill. If humans can live in harmony with other forms of life, the world rejoices. If not, the world suffers--and may not survive." -- T. A. Barron

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by George W. Bush
item.description: "Our enemies are innovative and resourceful, and so are we. They never stop thinking about new ways to harm our country and our people, and neither do we." -- George W. Bush

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You wouldn't worry so much about what others think of you if you realized how seldom they do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "You could move.' ---"Dear Abby" responds to a reader who complained that a gay couple was moving in across the street and wanted to know what he could do to improve the quality of the neighborhood." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by A.A. Milne
Kevin L. add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Absolute power does not corrupt absolutely, absolute power attracts the corruptible." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Victor J. Banis
item.description: "It doesn't matter what the question is, Alex, the answer is always love" -- Victor J. Banis

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "The truth is, once you learn how to die, you learn how to live." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Henry Adams
item.description: "A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops." -- Henry Adams

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "Not only our actions, but also our omissions, become our destiny." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "A rich man's faults are covered with money, but a surgeon's faults are covered with earth." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description:
"Not only our actions, but also our omissions, become our destiny.
From "Cutting for Stone" -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "...guilt leads to righteous action, but rarely is it the right action." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "If you live to be one hundred, you've got it made. Very few people die past that age. " -- George Burns

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by Beth Hoffman
item.description: "It's how we survive the hurt in life that brings us strength and gives us beauty." -- Beth Hoffman

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "I believe there is another world waiting for us. A better world. And I'll be waiting for you there." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Kevin L. add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future." -- David Mitchell
